metadata.title: CVE-2016-9913 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
Memory leak in the v9fs_device_unrealize_common function in hw/9pfs/9p.c inQEMU (aka Quick Emulator) allows local privileged guest OS users to cause adenial of service (host memory consumption and possibly QEMU process crash)via vectors involving the order of resource cleanup.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9913` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-block-extra - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-guest-agent - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-kvm - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-arm - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-common - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-mips - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-misc - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-ppc - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-s390x - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-sparc - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-x86 - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-user - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-user-static - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-utils - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: qemu package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2').
